byline.contributor: Patrick Healy reported from Rochester, and Matt Flegenheimer from New York. Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Las Vegas, and Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Martin from New York.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

abstract: Republican presidential candidates try to put the most positive spin possible on their debate performances for their donors and supporters, even as some of them falter in the polls following the latest nationally televised debate.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin and Jeb Bush were among those working to shine up their images in appearances and calls with supporters on Thursday.

headline.main: After Debate, Republicans Try to Alter Perceptions of Their Performance
headline.print_headline: After Debate, Republicans Try to Alter Perceptions of Their Performance

snippet: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin and Jeb Bush were among those working to shine up their images in appearances and calls with supporters on Thursday.
